Article.ArticleTitle: Irpexols A-C, xanthone derivatives from the endophyte fungus Irpex laceratus A878.

AbstractText: Three new xanthone derivatives irpexols A-C (1-3) and five known xanthones including three dimeric ones were successfully isolated from Irpex laceratus A878, an endophytic fungus of the family Irpicaceae from the medicinal plant Pogostemon cablin (Blanco) Bentham (Lamiaceae). The structures of these compounds were elucidated by extensive spectroscopic analyses including ultraviolet-visible spectroscopy (UV), infrared spectroscopy (IR), mass spectrometry (MS), and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR). All of the three new compounds (1-3) share a de-aromatic and highly‑oxygenated xanthone skeleton. In addition, the cytotoxic activity of compounds 1-8 were evaluated against SF-268, MCF-7, HepG2, and A549 tumor cell lines. The results revealed that compound 6 showed moderate cytotoxic activity with the IC<sub>50</sub> values ranging from 24.83 to 45.46 μM, while the IC<sub>50</sub> values of the positive control adriamycin was ranging from 1.11 to 1.44 μM.
